newsitem.title: CANADA: Philip down on Q1 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Philip down on Q1 earnings.

text.p: Shares in Philip Environmental Inc lost about 17 percent of their value on Thursday after the waste management firm posted softer than expected first-quarter earnings late on Wednesday, analysts said.

"They're down specifically because the company met consensus earnings expectations with the aid of a two-cent gain," said Midland Walwyn analyst Peter von Ond. Philip earned US$0.16 a share, including residual gains from earlier mergers with AllWaste Inc and Serv-Tech Inc, versus year earlier C$0.09. Philip dropped 3.75 to 17.85 in moderate trading on the Toronto Stock Exchange.
In New York, Philip lost 2-5/8 to 12-7/8.
"From the operational standpoint, the company only earns US$0.14 (a share) from US$0.16," von Ond said.
Von Ond forecast a Toronto share price of C$34 in a year as Philip stock recovered and resumed its recent rise. ((lydia.zajc@reuters.com, Reuters Toronto Bureau (416) 941-8109))
